indeed.translation[0].definitions[0].def: used to emphasize a statement or answer
indeed.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: The blood tests prove that Vince is indeed the father.
‘Would it help if you had an assistant?’ ‘It would indeed.’
indeed.translation[0].definitions[1].def: used to introduce an additional statement that emphasizes or supports what you have just said
indeed.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: I didn’t mind at all. Indeed, I was pleased.
indeed.translation[0].definitions[2].def: used with ‘very’ and an adjective or adverb to emphasize a statement or description
indeed.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Most of the essays were very good indeed.
indeed.translation[0].definitions[3].def: used to show that you are surprised or annoyed by something that someone has just told you
indeed.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: ‘He said he was too busy to see you.’ ‘Did he, indeed?’
